alert.note: Alert for Eastern Columbia; Eastern Dutchess; Eastern Ulster; Western Columbia; Western Dutchess (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 2:22PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Ulster, northwestern Dutchess and southwestern Columbia Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 222 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Saugerties, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Saugerties, Livingston, Pine Plains, Clermont, Red Hook, Ancram, Lake Katrine, Saugerties South, Bethel, Veteran, Milan, Germantown, Tivoli, Centerville, Pachin Mills, Kerleys Corners, Quarryville, Katsbaan, Sweet Meadows and Linden Acres. This includes Interstate 87 near exit 20. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for east central New York.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Columbia; Eastern Dutchess; Eastern Ulster; Western Columbia; Western Dutchess
